DOC.brief_summary: ASUKI Step design increase number day employee walk 10,000 step reduce number day employee spend inactive . Study aim : 1. minimum 400 employee participant university site reach level 10 , 000 step per day least 100 day ( 3.5 month ) trial period ; 2. 70 % employee participant university site maintain two few inactive day per week , define level le 3,000 step per day ; 3. describe socio-demographic , psychosocial , environmental health-related determinant success intervention ; 4. evaluate effect pedometer-based walk intervention university set change self-perceived health stress level , sleep pattern , anthropometric measure fitness .
DOC.detailed_description: ASUKI Step 9-month pedometer-based worksite intervention conduct Karolinska Institutet ( KI ) Stockholm , Sweden Arizona State University ( ASU ) great Phoenix area , Arizona . ASUKI Step use quasi-experimental design base theory social support . Participants include 2,118 faculty , staff , graduate student ASU ( n = 712 ) KI ( n = 1,406 ) participate teams 3-4 person . The intervention require participant accumulate 10,000 step day six month , 3-month follow-up period . Steps record onto study-specific website . Participants complete website-delivered questionnaire four time identify socio-demographic , health , psychosocial environmental correlate study participation . One person team university location randomly select complete physical fitness test determine anthropometric cardiovascular health wear accelerometer one week . Incentives give compliance study protocol include weekly raffle participation prize grand finale trip Arizona Sweden team day 10,000 step .
DOC.criteria: Employed Arizona State University ( ASU ) Karolinska Institute ( KI ) The ability read , speak understand English ( ASU ) Not currently pregnant lactate Free physical problem affect ability walk , e ) age 18 old Inability walk Not employ graduate student ASU KI
